fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21328].
  {panel}

Add support for tel: URI as described in RFC 3966. 
This is used by iOS on the iPhone and also seems to be used by Microsoft Office Communicator.
More info about the RFC:
http://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3966.txt
Now a "tel:0123456789" will be rendered as a wiki link instead of a URL. This should be changed to the behaviour which is implemented for the mailto: (RFC 2368) URL handling.
When the URI is written like "tel://012345678" it seems to work, but not for all applications.
fields.summary: Add support for tel: URI as described in RFC 3966.

fields.description:
This was originally a problem request in confluence support.  They recommended here.

I find myself using confluence more and more often. Since I regularly use onenote and outlook to do nearly all my writing, i have come to also anticipate confluence performing like these applications. Namely, i would like to have confluence perform simple autocorrecting in my text. Things like always capitalizing after a . (period) and a space because it knows you started a new sentence. Things like always capitalizing I, or days of the week or months of the year. Simple things.

I'm not talking about something like firefox's typo-notifier. i just want new senteces always capitalized and simple typos (like the fifth word of this sentence) just corrected for me. It is features like this that draw me to applications when i am typing in a professional capacity.

I guess i would like some info on whether or not this kind of feature will become available soon, or if it can be found in a plugin perhaps.

Thanks,
Patrick
fields.summary: status of enhanced editing capabilities in confluence

fields.description:
It's clear from the code that the 500page.jsp has been written to avoid calling the database.  Eg it calls getSafeDatabaseInfo, which gets all the information one can get about the database without getting a connection.

Unfortunately, at some stage, the getConfluenceInfo method of the sysInfoService has broken this rule. It goes to the database for at least the list of enabled plugins.  What's more, it gets this data even when it doesn't display it.

This is particularly a problem when there is a problem contacting the database, or the database connection pool is full, since the errors that try to report the problem with the database then generate more errors when trying to contact the database.
fields.summary: 500page.jsp should not retrieve data from the databse

fields.description:
Confluence's heartbeat code sends a heartbeat straight away and then every 5 minutes after that. We could improve our load factor by removing the initial send (because it's redundant).

Very small change... very small win.
fields.summary: Minor Confluence performance improvement by removing redundant initial session heartbeat
Long words in tables fail to wrap in PDF exports

fields.description:
The macro browser will not add a macro to a page using the rich text editor, when the macro is from an externally added gadget.

What I did (IE8, Win7):
# Installed JIRA 4.2 (with GH 5.3), Confluence 3.4.1. Hooked both up to Crowd 2.0.7.
# Set up trusted apps between JIRA and Confluence.
# Added JIRA Pie Chart gadget to my list of external gadgets in Confluence.
# Edited an existing page in Confluence using the RTE. 
# Selected Pie Chart gadget from list of gadgets. 
# Entered gadget config details and viewed the preview successfully.
# Clicked 'Insert' button. Macro browser dialogue disappeared, but nothing was added to the page.

I can add the macro manually using the wiki markup editor, e.g. 
{noformat}
{gadget:url=http://alui-PC:8080/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:pie-chart-gadget/gadgets/piechart-gadget.xml|width=450}
projectOrFilterId=project-10000&statType=resolution&isConfigured=true&refresh=false
{gadget}
{noformat}
fields.summary: Cannot add macros from external gadgets using RTE macro browser

fields.summary: Demonstration space uses macros that are not included in a default install

fields.description:
In Confluence 3.4, we added support for the {expand} user macro and made the code available for administrators to add to their wikis.

In Confluence 3.5, we plan to ship the {expand} user macro with Confluence.

The problem: When you export pages to HTML, the text between the macro tags is not visible. This is a problem for the Atlassian documentation, and also for any customers who use the {expand} user macro and export their pages to HTML.
fields.summary: Body of the 'Expand' user macro is not included in the HTML export

fields.description: I attempted to select text in confluence.gdev.com. I selected some text near top of page, then clicked on the scrollbar thumb at the right side of the browser to scroll down to the bottom of the page. Next, I received a message box prompting me about a Drag and Drop add-on feature. At this point, the browser hung with the perpetual hourglass, requiring that I start Task Manager in order to kill the app. Please note: clicking and dragging the scrollbar thumb is not the same as clicking and dragging selected text.
fields.summary: Selecting text, then moving scrollbar button generates a prompt for Drag and Drop add-on, then hangs browser in IE8

fields.description:
Korean characters are swallowed (ie. replaced) as one types in a new page, using IE as a browser (7 and 8).

This problem appears to only affect Korean language and only replicateable in a specific way:
# Ensure you have Korean language installed in Windows and enabled.
# Go to a space and create a new page (only fail in a new page)
# If you are using wiki markup, switch to Rich Text Editor. Otherwise type xpmt and a space character afterwards.
# Type the same characters sequence again to see what the correct ones should look like.

Problem does not affect wiki markup and the next character sequence input. It does not affect an existing page.
fields.summary: Korean characters are swallowed in IE when editing in Rich Text Editor in a new page

fields.description:
I have used the cli to export the entire site which worked fine in Confluence 3.4 but now, after upgrade to 3.4.2, it throws a MalformedURLException error.


on Confluence version: 3.4.0, build: 2029
# java -jar /opt/confluence-cli/release/confluence-cli-1.5.0.jar --server https://intranet.xxxxxxxxxx.de:8443 --user cli --password a1917558f10db6bb --action exportSite --file /tmp/confluence-backup-site.zip --exportAttachments
Site exported with url:https://intranet.xxxxxxxxxx.de:8443/download/temp/xmlexport-20101121-175746-1.zip to file: /tmp/confluence-backup-site.zip with elapsed time: 0 minutes


on Confluence version: 3.4.2, build: 2032
# java -jar /opt/confluence-cli/release/confluence-cli-1.5.0.jar --server https://intranet.xxxxxxxxxx.de:8443 --user cli --password a1917558f10db6bb --action exportSite --file /tmp/confluence-backup-site.zip --exportAttachments
Client error: java.net.MalformedURLException: no protocol: The backup was successfully created at /opt/confluence-data/temp/xmlexport-20101121-181109-2.zip. This file will be deleted in 24 hours.?os_username=cli&os_password=a1917558f10db6bb

The created file xmlexport-20101121-181109-2.zip exits and it contains a valid backup, but it's not moved to the given destination.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21297].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to reproduce

# Create a space called test
# Create a page called test
# Add an attachment to the test page
# Add the same attachment to the test page
#* Here's how it will look in filesystem:
{quote}
jsashi@localhost:~/confluenceData/confluenceData34/attachments/ver003/245/52/1802245/188/171/1671188/1736713$ ls
1
jsashi@localhost:~/confluenceData/confluenceData34/attachments/ver003/245/52/1802245/188/171/1671188/1736713$ ls
1  2
{quote}
1671188 is the pageid and 1736713 is the attachment id
#* Here's how it will look in database:
{quote}
+--------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------------------+---------+---------+---------------------+--------------+---------------------+----------+--------------------------------------------------------+------------+---------+
| ATTACHMENTID | TITLE                                         | CONTENTTYPE              | PAGEID  | CREATOR | CREATIONDATE        | LASTMODIFIER | LASTMODDATE         | FILESIZE | ATTACHMENT_COMMENT                                     | ATTVERSION | PREVVER |
+--------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------------------+---------+---------+---------------------+--------------+---------------------+----------+--------------------------------------------------------+------------+---------+
|      1736713 | 181.jpg                                       | image/jpeg               | 1671188 | admin   | 2010-11-19 16:52:33 | admin        | 2010-11-19 16:52:33 |   166253 |                                                        |          2 |    NULL | 
|      1736714 | 181.jpg                                       | image/jpeg               | 1671188 | admin   | 2010-11-19 16:51:34 | admin        | 2010-11-19 16:51:34 |   166253 |                                                        |          1 | 1736713 | 
{quote}
* Note: The latest attachment will get the same ATTACHMENTID as the folder in filesystem
# Remove the test space
# Space will get removed without any problem. However, the following will be shown in the log:
{quote}
2010-11-19 16:59:09,301 ERROR [http-8080-5] [pages.persistence.dao.FileSystemAttachmentDataDao] removeDataForAttachment Could not find attachments to remove at '/home/jsashi/confluenceData/confluenceData34/attachments/ver003/245/52/1802245/188/171/1671188/1736714'
 -- space: 1802245 | url: /spaces/doremovespace.action | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:8080/spaces/removespace.action?key=eeeee | action: doremovespace
{quote}

h5. Intended behaviour
It is true that the folder 1736714 does not exist in the filesystem as only the original attachmentid will be used as the folder name and all subsequent versions of the same attachment will be available as 1,2,3, etc within the original folder. However, this ERROR message in the log can be confusing to users whom might think that they have missing attachments.

fields.description:
Even if the anonymous user has attachment permissions they are not able to attach files to a new page via the image/link browser.


Steps to reproduce:

1) Allow Anonymous users create page and add attachment permissions to space. 
2) Log out and access the space as an anonymous user 
3) Create new page and click link on insert image. 
4) It will not give you the option to upload a new image. 

If you save the page and edit again and click insert image, then it will allow you upload the image.

Using the standalone 3.4.1 out of the box with the default theme

On the pages where we can have a file attachment the gear message shows up as "Drop files here to attach them"

The text is not localized if I set French as my language, the same text appears.
Not tested in German.

Similar issue when in the editor you click on insert image. There is a drop zone and a text "Drop here"... in French


I know that you are looking at HTML 5 to replace gear but in the mean time thanks to localize the text properly for the ones who will use 3.X for the next two years of maintenance

fields.description:
Working in English with the default theme
Using confluence standalone demo with no change.
On the admin / license screen I get for the license expiration 

License Expiration 	Your evaluation expires in 2 , 21 . 

In the log I have 
2010-11-18 10:04:01,203 ERROR [http-6080-8] [atlassian.core.util.DateUtils] getText java.util.MissingResourceException: Can't find resource for bundle com.atlassian.confluence.util.i18n.CombinedResourceBundle, key core.dateutils.days
2010-11-18 10:04:01,203 ERROR [http-6080-8] [atlassian.core.util.DateUtils] getText java.util.MissingResourceException: Can't find resource for bundle com.atlassian.confluence.util.i18n.CombinedResourceBundle, key core.dateutils.hours

It should be 
License Expiration 	Your evaluation expires in 2 days, 21 hours. 

Note All good in French and German !!!! Just failing in English
Expiration de la licence 	Votre version d'évaluation expire dans 16 derniers jours, 21 heures. 
Ablauf der Lizenz 	Ihre Evaluierung läuft in 16 Tage, 21 Stunden ab. 

I have seen other cases where the resources for minutes, seconds... are reported missing too>

Look at my comments below to see how to reproduce the issue and what are the root/design issues to fix.
I have the issue in the administration screen but I would think that the issue can happen everywhere and that there is a flaw in the way the resources are managed.


Same issue on the system information page
In English Uptime = 1 , 1 , 4 , 24  
in French  Temps d'utilisation	1 jour, 1 heure, 33 minutes, 35 secondes

fields.description:
Files which have a pipe in their filename cannot be uploaded into Confluence. When trying to do this via dragn-and-drop, it appears as an image icon in the editor. When using the insert image dialog, it tries to make your browser download 'attachfile.action'.

*Workaround*: rename the file so it doesn't contain a pipe, then try uploading the file again.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21273].
  {panel}

I would like to be able to sort my "Favourite Pages" entries on the home page of our wiki. Now, they are sorted by the time I marked them as favourites. This is somewhat inexpedient, as I want to do 2 different things with these favourites:

    * quick links to pages I use often - these pages stay the same over a long time, e.g. tools and templates
    * quick links to pages that I have to check regularly only for a certain time, e.g. my current sales opportunities

I would like to separate the "robust" favourite pages from those favourite pages, which I will delete after a certain time. A possibility to order favourites would be great.
fields.summary: Re-Ordering of Favourite Pages

fields.description:
If the gallery macro is used with the optional sort option set to comment - {{{gallery:sort=comment}}} - but any of the attached images do not have a comment added, this will throw a NullPointerException error.  This should not be the case.

*Steps to Repro:*
# Add a page 
# Add image attachments, but do not add comments to the individual attachments
# Edit the page and the following wiki markup:
{{{gallery:sort=comment}}}
# Save

*Expected:*
The page loads and the gallery macro renders a table of images sorted by comment.  Any images without a comment will be sorted to show up at the beginning or end of the list.

*Actual:*
The following error is displayed:
{{Error formatting macro: gallery: java.lang.NullPointerException}}
fields.summary: gallery macro sort by comment throws error if no comment is present

Described here http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+Tomcat%27s+URI+encoding

===============================

{code}
I use the default theme on the standalone version of confluence, basically out of the box.
I am logged as admin.

Tested with FF 3.6.5 and IE 8.

********* issues with a file with accents in the name ************

I have attached a file called "AnotherWordFileWithÁççëñtsButNothingSpecialInside.doc" (you have accents in the name and but no spaces)

The file contains just US ASCII text, no accents.

This file is attached.

Properties link

Remove link

I am stuck with this file.

Edit in Office link
http://localhost:8080/confluence/plugins/servlet/confluence/default/Global/ds/MyPage/AnotherWordFileWith%C3%81%C3%A7%C3%A7%C3%AB%C3%B1tsButNothingSpecialInside.doc

View link

FF: Page not found coming from confluence, no exception
IE: same
(function not present in 2.10.3)

I have not tried to rename a "normal" file in the properties but you should test these scenarios to (adding spaces, accents...)

Basically, either:
- you refuse to upload files with accents (and rename an existing file to now contain an accent)
- you accept to upload them but you replaced accented letters by non accented ones (e acute becomes e...)
- you accept to upload them (like you already do) but you provide full support. If based on the presence or the type of client (IE, FF...), you can do something with one browser but not with another then you should hide the links or disable them. E.g. the "Edit in Office" link could become if you use FF which cannot do it "You cannot edit with FF, use IE".

We are upgrading from 2.10.3 to 3.4.1.

Some file attachments have accents, this will be an issue!!!!!

********* issues with a file with spaces in the name ************

I have attached a file called "A word file.doc"  (you have a spaces in the name but no accents)
The file is attached to a page with no space or accent in the name.
The page is just below the home page of the demonstration space of the demo database.
The file contains just US ASCII text, no accents.

This file is attached.

all OK

Edit in Office link
http://localhost:8080/confluence/plugins/servlet/confluence/default/Global/ds/MyPage/A%20word%20file.doc
FF: I give my credentials in word then I get from Word "Could not open http://localhost:8080/confluence/plugins/servlet/confluence/default/Global/ds/MyPage/A word file.doc".
This is related to non HTTP friendly characters in the URL
IE : same

View link
http://localhost:8080/confluence/pages/worddav/preview.action?fileName=A+word+file.doc&pageId=983042
FF: OK but if I click on edit I have the same error as just upper.
IE : same

I have not tried to rename a "normal" file in the properties but you should test these scenarios to (adding spaces, accents...)

Basically, either:
- you refuse to upload files with spaces (and rename an existing file to now contain a space)
- you accept to upload them but you remove the spaces
- you accept to upload them (like you already do) but you provide full support. If based on the presence or the type of client (IE, FF...), you can do something with one browser but not with another then you should hide the links or disable them. E.g. the "Edit in Office" link could become if you use FF which cannot do it "You cannot edit with FF, use IE".

********* issues with a file with no space in the name but in a page with a space ************

I have attached a file called "AnotherWordFile.doc"  (you have NO spaces)
The file is attached to a page called "My Page With Spaces", it contains spaces
The file contains just US ascii text, no accents.

all OK

This is related to non HTTP friendly characters in the URL
IE: same

View link
http://localhost:8080/confluence/pages/worddav/preview.action?fileName=AnotherWordFile.doc&pageId=983044
FF: OK but if I click on edit I have the same error as just upper.
IE: same

I have not tried to rename a "normal" page in the properties but you should test these scenarios to (adding spaces, accents...)

There must be a way to support pages with spaces in the names

********* issues with a file with no space in the name but in a page with an accent ************

I have attached a file called "AnotherWordFile.doc"  (you have NO spaces)
The file is attached to a page called "MaPageàMoi", it contains an accented a
The file contains just US ASCII text, no accents.

This file is attached.

This is a variation on the above scenario with a page with spaces in the name.
Everything works fine EXCEPT the Office edition

Link to open the file, Properties link, Remove link
all OK

Edit in Office link
http://localhost:8080/confluence/plugins/servlet/confluence/default/Global/ds/MaPageàMoi/AnotherWordFile.doc
FF: I give my credentials in word then I get from Word "Could not open http://localhost:8080/confluence/plugins/servlet/confluence/default/Global/ds/MaPageàMoi/AnotherWordFile.doc".
This is related to non HTTP friendly characters in the URL
(same scenario if view then edit)
IE: same

View:
OK but problem if I then decide to edit

I have not tried to rename a space to create the issue on an existing page

There must be a way to support pages with accents in the names

*************************

Overall, I think that having the page name in the URL used to edit in word is a bad choice, you should use the page ID only like everywhere else.
Not sure if the page ID is unique but I would think so.
In this case, why do we need to have the space name in the URL? The page ID should be enough.
This is just a risk of issues for spaces with spaces, accents...

*************************

not tested a space with accents in the name but it could be interesting

the files are word 2003 versions
{code}

fields.description:
Hi, Atlassian!

After I had created a usage query at Atlassian support(CSP-54145) which was
{quote}
We need the ability to allow only specified users to view some pages. Currently the only found solution is to restrict viewing to all groups and users who are allowed to view the page by space permissions which is not convenient.
How can we manage to allow only some specified users to view some definite page?
{quote}
support team suggested me to raise a new feature request here. 

Currently we can only restrict some users/group to view/edit some page. What we need is to allow only some users/groups to view some page.

We look forward to having this feature in the future Confluence releases.

Regards,
Mikalai
fields.summary: Confluence: allow only specified users to view a page

fields.description:
The {{\{details\}}} macro (part of the bundled [Tabular Metadata Plugin|http://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/TABMETA]) displays the list of metadata items on the page. Some users may prefer to keep the metadata out of the rendered page content, but if you wrap the macro with another macro that suppresses rendering its contents, then the metadata is never associated with the page. In other words, the {{\{details\}}} macro needs to be invoked to work properly.

So it would be nice if it offered a {{hidden}} parameter that you could set to {{true}} to avoid displaying the content, like you can with the {{\{excerpt\}}} macro.
fields.summary: Allow the output of the {details} macro to be hidden from the page

fields.description:
The new trash management functions in the remote API need to be documented. I've written a quick first draft below, hopefully that will help. :)

h2. Under Remote Methods > Spaces > Management

* ContentSummaries getTrashContents(String token, String spaceKey, int offset, int count) - get the contents of the trash for the given space, starting at 'offset' and returning at most 'count' items.
* boolean purgeFromTrash(String token, String spaceKey, long contentId) - remove some content from the trash in the given space, deleting it permanently
* boolean emptyTrash(String token, String spaceKey) - remove all content from the trash in the given space, deleting them permanently

h2. Under Data Objects:

h3. ContentSummaries

|| Key || Type || Value ||
| totalAvailable | int | The total number of content available to be retrieved |
| offset | int | the index of the first content retrieved |
| content | Vector of ContentSummary | list of the retrieved content |

h3. ContentSummary

|| Key || Type || Value ||
| id | String | the id of the content |
| type | String | The type of content (e.g. "page", "comment", "blog") |
| space | String | the key of the space to which the content belongs |
| status | String | the current status of the content (e.g. "current", "deleted") |
| title | String | the title of the content |
| created | Date | timestamp page was created |
| creator | String | username of the creator |
| modified | Date | timestamp content was modified |
| modifier | String | username of content's last modifier |
fields.summary: 3.5 Documentation - Trash Management RPC Functions

fields.description:
The Windows Evaluation installer for Confluence stand-alone attempts to extract the confluence resources to {{%PROGRAMFILES%\Confluence Evaluation}}. From Windows Vista onwards, writing to %PROGRAMFILES% is an elevated operation and requires administrative privileges granted by UAC.

Applications that require administrative access should advertise this requirement to the host system via an application manifest embedded in the executable. Applications without this will simply get permission denied errors unless the user specifically selects to "Run As Administrator" from the right-click context menu.

The Confluence installer does not have an application manifest, and we do not provide any instructions to users on running the installer with administrative privileges. I think this is fairly critical barrier to entry for Confluence evaluators. For the average guy/gal installing Confluence for the first time, the installer will simply fail with an unhelpful error message.

Embedding a manifest in the installer executable should be pretty easy (see [http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb756929.aspx]), although I guess it would depend on whether the packager we are using to create the installer supports custom manifests.

Alternatively, the installer could write to a non-privileged directory by default, such as %PROGRAMDATA%.
fields.summary: Windows Evaluation Installer should have requireAdministrator manifest embedded

fields.description:
If a plugin with a servlet filter issues a forward to a confluence (or plugin) resource, the http-filters defined in the confluence web.xml file will not be applied. 

This is because they only trigger on the REQUEST dispatcher (the default) and not when they are forwarded to.  If there is no dispatcher specified then the filter-mapping only applies to the REQUEST type, see: http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/j2ee/web-app_2_4.xsd.

{quote}
The dispatcher has four legal values: FORWARD, REQUEST, INCLUDE,
and ERROR. A value of FORWARD means the Filter will be applied
under RequestDispatcher.forward() calls.  A value of REQUEST
means the Filter will be applied under ordinary client calls to
the path or servlet. A value of INCLUDE means the Filter will be
applied under RequestDispatcher.include() calls.  A value of
ERROR means the Filter will be applied under the error page
mechanism.  The absence of any dispatcher elements in a
filter-mapping indicates a default of applying filters only under
ordinary client calls to the path or servlet.
{quote}


It's common to want to use a servlet-filter module to rewrite pretty URLs to actions implemented in confluence or a plugin.
fields.summary: Required Confluence servlet filters not applied after filter-module performs a .forward

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21228].
  {panel}

Some QA usability feedback:

* Take a screenshot of a webpage, approx 1000*1000 pixels
* Upload it to a confluence page
* Use the property panel on the image, and resize it to "Large"
* Save the page

Now when a user views that page, they see the image scaled down to 300*300 pixels. This means that it is too small to read the content. The user is used to clicking on scaled-down images to see them in full-size, and is confused because this does not work in this case.

The problem is that from the point of view of a user viewing the page, they don't care whether the image is "small", "medium" or "large". If the image is too small to see properly, they will want to click it to see in full-size. But Confluence will only expand images that are "small" or "medium"; clicking on a "large" image will do nothing.

Maybe the behaviour should be that if the image displayed is smaller than the full sized image, then it should be expandable.

Or else, just simply make all images expandable, whatever the size.
fields.summary: Editor Properties Panel: When a large image is resized to "large" it actually becomes too small to see, and cannot be expanded

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21208].
  {panel}

As far as I understand the documentation and tests are showing the RSS Feed Builder combines labels with the logical OR operator.

I would like to AND the labels when building an RSS feed - either manually or by the RSS feed builder - instead of the present default OR-ing.

Regular Confluence label work (e.g. contentbylabel macro) allows explicit logical operators by adding and/or signs to force or exclude the presence of a label. When working with rss feeds this doesn't seem to work.
 AND-ing means: "...matches all of the labels...". If I adapted the logic to the contentbylabel macro I would write 'labels=+hummingbird,+blackbird' (show me all content about hummingbirds and blackbirds - but not content labelled with only one of 'blackbird' or 'hummingbird').

An analogy to contentbylabel might look something like:
http://my.wiki.org/createrssfeed.action?types=blogpost&...&labelString=%2Bhummingbird,%2Bblackbird&rssType=atom&maxResults...os_authType=basic (URL-encoded + and even - signs)

And what would be even more comfortable is the explicit exclusion of labels: Show me all content that provides (at least) the labels "bear, dog" but not "cat". If I adapted the logic to the contentbylabel macro I would write 'labels=+bird,-hummingbird' (show me all content about birds, but exclude content about hummingbirds.").

As I noted I am looking for the label functionality (use of logical operators) in rss feeds (Feed Builder, generated URLs) I know from the contentbylabel macro e.g..
fields.summary: AND-ing of labels ins RSS feeds

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Set the Global theme to a plugin, such as the Documentation Theme
# Disable that plugin
# Logout

Instead of the login screen you'll get this:
{noformat}
Error occurred during template rendering: Invocation of method 'getThemeJsResources' in class $Proxy51 threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at template/includes/macros.vm[line 629, column 26]. Contact your administrator for assistance.
{noformat}

And the logs will have lots of these:
{noformat}
 -- url: /login.action | userName: anonymous
org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getThemeJsResources' in  class $Proxy51 threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at template/includes/macros.vm[line 629, column 26]
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.handleInvocationException(ASTMethod.java:337)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.execute(ASTMethod.java:284)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.execute(ASTReference.java:252)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.render(ASTReference.java:332)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTBlock.render(ASTBlock.java:72)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.directive.VelocimacroProxy.render(VelocimacroProxy.java:212)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.directive.RuntimeMacro.render(RuntimeMacro.java:247)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTDirective.render(ASTDirective.java:175)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTBlock.render(ASTBlock.java:72)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIfStatement.render(ASTIfStatement.java:87)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.SimpleNode.render(SimpleNode.java:336)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.directive.Parse.render(Parse.java:260)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTDirective.render(ASTDirective.java:175)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTBlock.render(ASTBlock.java:72)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.directive.VelocimacroProxy.render(VelocimacroProxy.java:212)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.directive.RuntimeMacro.render(RuntimeMacro.java:247)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTDirective.render(ASTDirective.java:175)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTBlock.render(ASTBlock.java:72)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.directive.VelocimacroProxy.render(VelocimacroProxy.java:212)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.directive.RuntimeMacro.render(RuntimeMacro.java:247)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTDirective.render(ASTDirective.java:175)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.SimpleNode.render(SimpleNode.java:336)
        at org.apache.velocity.Template.merge(Template.java:328)
        at org.apache.velocity.Template.merge(Template.java:235)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.util.velocity.VelocityUtils.renderTemplateWithoutSwallowingErrors(VelocityUtils.java:62)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.util.velocity.VelocityUtils.renderTemplateWithoutSwallowingErrors(VelocityUtils.java:68)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.util.profiling.ConfluenceSitemeshDecorator$StreamingResponseWritingStrategy.renderToResponse(ConfluenceSitemeshDecorator.java:160)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.util.profiling.ConfluenceSitemeshDecorator.applyDecoratorUsingVelocity(ConfluenceSitemeshDecorator.java:111)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.util.profiling.ConfluenceSitemeshDecorator.applyDecorator(ConfluenceSitemeshDecorator.java:54)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.util.profiling.ProfilingPageFilter.applyDecorator(ProfilingPageFilter.java:65)
        at com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.filter.PageFilter.doFilter(PageFilter.java:61)
{noformat}

Note that some theme plugins have been known to occasionally have some modules missing [CONF-19144].

h3. Workaround
Since the error comes from a decorator you can work around it be passing the decorator=none param, like so:
# Go to http://<baseurl>/login.action?decorator=none and login
# Go to http://<baseurl>/admin/viewplugins.action?decorator=none
# Click on the problematic plugin, then append &decorator=none to the URL
# Click Enable Plugin

If you have authenticated admin sessions turned on it complicates matters but the same tactic works.
If the theme is *broken* and can't be enabled then instead go to 
# http://localhost:8341/admin/choosetheme.action?decorator=none and change the enabled theme.

h3. Other Workaround
If none of the above helps and you have access to the database then:
# Stop Confluence
# Run the following SQL query
{code:sql}select * from bandana where bandana.bandanacontext = '_GLOBAL' and bandana.bandanakey = 'atlassian.confluence.theme.settings'{code}
# Confirm it returned only 1 row.  Then delete that row by running
{code:sql}delete from bandana where bandana.bandanacontext = '_GLOBAL' and bandana.bandanakey = 'atlassian.confluence.theme.settings'{code}
# Commit
# Restart Confluence

h3. Suggested fixes?
Harden the login and admin screens against this theme breakage.
Provide the means to clear the global theme at start-up.
fields.summary: Disabling the global theme prevents users from logging in due to getThemeJsResources problem

fields.description:
When an admin goes to Confluence Admin > Mail Servers they can add an SMTP server to be used for sending notifications of watches.  However, after 1 server is added, the "Add a new SMTP mail server" link allows numerous subsequent servers to be added, despite the fact that the function of these additional servers is unclear.  It appears only the 1st server in the list is used to send notifications and that the other servers don't have any function.

The ability to add multiple SMTP servers should be removed as it is misleading and confusing to users.
fields.summary: Remove ability to add more than 1 SMTP server

fields.description:
SER-154 is breaking some customers custom authenticators.

I have attached a patch for Seraph as a temporary work around. See [this|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Custom+SSOAuthenticators+do+not+work+after+upgrading+to+Confluence+3.4+and+above] KB article for installation instructions.
fields.summary: Bug in seraph breaks custom authenticators

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21194].
  {panel}

This error affects JIRA 4.2 and also 4.1 and 4.0 documentation (I didn't check for previous versions).

Some pages show ONE attachment but actually the have MORE than one in the attachment list (see for example these pages: JIRA 4.0.1 Release Notes, JIRA 4.0.2 Release Notes, JIRA 3.13.3 Release Notes, JIRA 3.13.4 Release Notes, JIRA 3.13.5 Release Notes and __flowchart_installation_master_v1).

This cause a system error if you try to delete the page or the entire space. To delete the page you need: 1) delete all attachments and 2) delete the page.

Actually, the problem is to identify the pages affected by this trouble.
fields.summary: Inconsistent attachment number and list in documentation

fields.description:
I'm not certain of the steps taken, but I now see a duplicate user in the Directory of People (with identical details). But when I navigate to manage users in the Confluence Admin area, I only see one user.

I noticed that changing details in one automatically change details in another. Status updates also seem to be related to both.

The issue is that licensing is based on this user count, which is unacceptable since there are really 8 users, but confluence reports them as 9.
fields.summary: Duplicate User Profile Created

fields.description:
# Install a brand new confluence 3.3.1
# Go to Plugin Repository
# Click the Upload tab
# Browse to find a plugin file to upload.  I tested with both the confluence-su plugin 1.2.1 and the adaptavist rate macro 3.0.
# Click Upload

\\
*Expected Result* Plugin uploaded and enabled

*Actual Result* 
# The screen says "Completed adding / updating 1 plugin(s)." 
# An IllegalArgumentException occurs and writes a stack trace to the atlassian-confluence.log
# The plugin is listed in the PLUGINDATA table
# There will be a copy of the jar in home/plugin-cache and home/temp
# The plugin is not listed in the Plugin Repository page 
# The plugin is not enabled

\\
This was a result of my testing from [CSP-52394|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-52394]
fields.summary: Uploading a plugin via Plugin Repository Upload causes IllegalArgumentException

fields.description:
Your Blogs Home Page - http://blogs.atlassian.com/confluence/ is a centralized destination where users can view and search blogs by subject (in your case, by product type).  One of your child topic pages in the Confluence Blog area -  http://blogs.atlassian.com/confluence/ where people can filter by date and / or author. 

I believe that this type of functionality would be very beneficial for our Internal Confluence Wiki in addition to the current functionality which attaches Blogs to wiki pages and returns blogs as a search result via labeling.

Thank you!
fields.summary: Blogs Home Page
Show Fewer / Show More
